description.zh-cn: 位于意大利首都罗马市区内的内陆城邦，由天主教会最高权力机构圣座直接统治，为世界领土面积最小的国家。
description.en: An independent city-state and enclave located within Rome, Italy. The Vatican City State is ruled by the Pope, the bishop of Rome and head of the Catholic Church.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会的最高权力机构，在国际法上是主权实体。
description.en: The supreme body of government of the Catholic Church, which is a sovereign entity under international law.

description.zh-cn: 梵蒂冈城邦的前身，是在756年由“丕平献土”事件后成立的政教合一主权国家，其领土曾广及意大利半岛中部。
description.en: The predecessor to the Vatican City State, a sovereign theocratic state established in 756 after the 'Donation of Pepin', which once controlled large territories in central Italy.

description.zh-cn: 由意大利王国与圣座为解决“罗马问题”而签订的条约，该条约承认梵蒂冈城为主权国家。
description.en: A treaty signed between the Kingdom of Italy and the Holy See to resolve the 'Roman Question', which recognized Vatican City as a sovereign state.

description.zh-cn: 意大利王国首相，代表意大利签署了《拉特兰条约》。
description.en: Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Italy, who signed the Lateran Treaty on behalf of Italy.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会第259任教宗，代表圣座签署了《拉特兰条约》。
description.en: The 259th Pope of the Catholic Church, who signed the Lateran Treaty on behalf of the Holy See.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪在意大利半岛发生的、旨在结束各国林立及外国势力干预，建立统一的意大利国家的政治及社会运动。
description.en: The 19th-century political and social movement that resulted in the consolidation of different states of the Italian Peninsula into a single state, the Kingdom of Italy.

description.zh-cn: 由萨丁尼亚王国主导成立，完成了意大利统一，并于1870年攻占罗马，终结了教宗国。
description.en: The state founded under the leadership of the Kingdom of Sardinia that completed the unification of Italy and ended the Papal States by capturing Rome in 1870.

description.zh-cn: 法兰西第二帝国皇帝，曾以“教会的保护者”名义派兵保护罗马，阻止意大利王国占领。
description.en: Emperor of the Second French Empire, who protected Rome with French troops in his capacity as 'protector of the Church', preventing its capture by the Kingdom of Italy.

description.zh-cn: 普鲁士王国与法兰西第二帝国之间的战争，导致法国撤回驻罗马军队，为意大利统一创造了条件。
description.en: A war between the Kingdom of Prussia and the Second French Empire, which led to the withdrawal of French troops from Rome, creating the conditions for Italian unification.

description.zh-cn: 一支负责保护教宗、宗座宫和梵蒂冈城的志愿禁卫队。
description.en: A volunteer guard unit responsible for the safety of the Pope, the Apostolic Palace, and Vatican City.

description.zh-cn: 罗马主教及普世天主教会的领袖，梵蒂冈城邦的国家元首。
description.en: The Bishop of Rome and leader of the worldwide Catholic Church, and head of state of Vatican City.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲国家，梵蒂冈城邦位于其首都罗马市内。
description.en: A European country, within whose capital, Rome, Vatican City is located.

description.zh-cn: 圣座的行政机构，协助教宗处理整个天主教会的事务。
description.en: The administrative apparatus of the Holy See, which assists the Pope in governing the Catholic Church.

description.zh-cn: 法兰克王国国王，将罗马城及其周围区域赠予教宗，史称“丕平献土”，奠定了教宗国的基础。
description.en: King of the Franks, who donated the city of Rome and its surrounding areas to the Pope, known as the 'Donation of Pepin', laying the foundation for the Papal States.

description.zh-cn: 法兰克国王丕平将意大利中部的大片领土赠予教宗的历史事件。
description.en: A historical event in which Pepin, King of the Franks, granted the Pope large territories in central Italy.

description.zh-cn: 《拉特兰条约》的签订，确立了梵蒂冈城邦为主权国家，解决了圣座与意大利政府间多年的纠纷。
description.en: The signing of the Lateran Treaty established Vatican City State as a sovereign nation, resolving the long-standing dispute between the Holy See and the Italian government.

description.zh-cn: 作为意大利首相，代表意大利王国签署了《拉特兰条约》。
description.en: As Prime Minister of Italy, he signed the Lateran Treaty on behalf of the Kingdom of Italy.

description.zh-cn: 作为教宗，代表圣座签署了《拉特兰条约》。
description.en: As Pope, he signed the Lateran Treaty on behalf of the Holy See.

description.zh-cn: 梵蒂冈城邦由天主教会的最高权力机构圣座直接统治。
description.en: Vatican City State is directly ruled by the Holy See, the supreme governing body of the Catholic Church.

description.zh-cn: 意大利的民族统一运动使圣座在意大利的领土愈来愈少，最终导致教宗国被意大利王国吞并。
description.en: The Italian unification movement progressively reduced the territory of the Papal States, eventually leading to its annexation by the Kingdom of Italy.

description.zh-cn: 1870年，意大利王国的军队开进罗马，完成了意大利的统一，终结了教宗国。
description.en: In 1870, the army of the Kingdom of Italy entered Rome, completing the unification of Italy and ending the Papal States.

description.zh-cn: 由于1870年普法战争爆发，拿破仑三世被迫调回驻扎在罗马的军队，从而无法继续保护教宗国。
description.en: Due to the outbreak of the Franco-Prussian War in 1870, Napoleon III was forced to withdraw his troops stationed in Rome, thus ending his protection of the Papal States.

description.zh-cn: 以“教会的保护者”名义出兵保护罗马，阻止意大利王国占领，直到普法战争爆发。
description.en: He sent troops to protect Rome under the title 'protector of the Church', preventing its occupation by the Kingdom of Italy until the Franco-Prussian War.

description.zh-cn: 瑞士近卫队是负责教宗人身安全的志愿禁卫队。
description.en: The Swiss Guard is a volunteer guard unit responsible for the personal safety of the Pope.

description.zh-cn: 罗马教廷宣布梵蒂冈不再自动采纳意大利议会通过的法律，理由是意大利法律过于繁杂且时常与天主教教义相违背。
description.en: The Roman Curia announced that the Vatican would no longer automatically adopt laws passed by the Italian parliament, citing that Italian legislation was too complex and often contrary to Catholic doctrine.

description.zh-cn: 法兰克国王丕平将罗马城及其周围区域送给教宗，这一事件被称为“丕平献土”。
description.en: Pepin, King of the Franks, gave the city of Rome and its surroundings to the Pope, an event known as the 'Donation of Pepin'.

description.zh-cn: “丕平献土”事件为教宗国的成立奠定了基础。
description.en: The 'Donation of Pepin' laid the foundation for the establishment of the Papal States.
